Posted By: Ritius (11/15/2009 6:04:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love to use this guy in a WU infect deck! [Blighted Agent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blighted Agent) becomes completly insane once this creepy alien hits the table! As long as you don't miss a land drop this is an easy 5th round win even if you get no other nasty creatures into play.  
Round 1: Island  
Round 2: Plains, play Blighted Agent  
Round 3: any land, swing for 1 infect, play Mirror Entity (opponent at 1 poison)  
Round 4: any land, activate entity for 4, swing for 4 infect (opponent at 5 poison)  
Round 5: any land, activate entity for 5, swing for 5 infect (opponent at 10 poison)
posts.html:
I love to use this guy in a WU infect deck! Blighted Agent becomes completly insane once this creepy alien hits the table! As long as you don't miss a land drop this is an easy 5th round win even if you get no other nasty creatures into play.
Round 1: Island
Round 2: Plains, play Blighted Agent
Round 3: any land, swing for 1 infect, play Mirror Entity (opponent at 1 poison)
Round 4: any land, activate entity for 4, swing for 4 infect (opponent at 5 poison)
Round 5: any land, activate entity for 5, swing for 5 infect (opponent at 10 poison)

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (5/31/2012 7:30:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Love him in my rebel deck. The look on an opponent's face when I tutor him out at the end of their turn and then swing with a ton of 4/4, 5/5 or bigger rebels is priceless. Works great with [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds) for that purpose, because you can declare x to be 5, and then you only have to pay 3, for example. Also, works well with [Peer Pressure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Peer Pressure) to steal any one (or more) of your opponent's creatures as long as you have more creatures out than they do.
posts.html:
Love him in my rebel deck. The look on an opponent's face when I tutor him out at the end of their turn and then swing with a ton of 4/4, 5/5 or bigger rebels is priceless. Works great with Training Grounds for that purpose, because you can declare x to be 5, and then you only have to pay 3, for example. Also, works well with Peer Pressure to steal any one (or more) of your opponent's creatures as long as you have more creatures out than they do.
